Reviews.Title: “Couldn't fault anything!”
Reviews.Author: AlvinAng
Reviews.Content: Stayed there over 2 days, had a party of 6. Very good value for money, location is outside of the Las Vegas strip, so nice and quiet. Will suit people with a car. Apart from that, the villas are clean, the kitchen is well equipped, and everything works. Plent of space as well and love the idea of having our inroom washing machine and dryers which are free to use. I really cannot fault anything during my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Relax, Play, @ Stay.”
Reviews.Author: Jackie S
Reviews.Content: After reading good & bad reviews, We took a chance & booked the DPR for a week.. Very nice! Our 2BR suite was newly remodeled. There was a LVG room, LDRY room, walk in closets, 2 Baths, & more. The full kitchen had new appliances, cooking utensils, & blender. My husband enjoyed the new gym each a.m. while I enjoyed the comfy king bed with 40 in. flat screen on the wall. After walking the Vegas strip in 80 - 90 degree sun each day, It was nice to return to the relaxing pool area & use the new grills when not stuffing ourselves @ a buffet(smile). You could eat by the pool or on your private patio where a cool breeze flowed. DPR has a polite staff & free shuttle with scheduled times/days to the grocery store, the strip, & more. (Resort is about 2 mi. off the strip). We rented a small car to go anywhere @ anytime. Would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place off the strip”
Reviews.Author: Travuler
Reviews.Content: Nice quiet, spacious suites. They are well-appointed, and have everything you need to be comfortable. Nice new flat-screens in each room. I stayed upstairs this time, and is much quieter than lower suites as you don't hear people upstairs. It is clean, well maintained throughout the property. The cleaning staff, and check out staff were all very pleasant and professional, but the "lead" clerk who checked me in made it seem like we were bothering her simply by checking in. There was no "hello" or no "welcome", not even a simple smile. Just a series of abrupt and automated responses, Not exactly the warm welcome you might expect of a place like this. I might as well just deal with a machine.

Reviews.Title: “Worst timeshare I've stayed in”
Reviews.Author: mymemories
Reviews.Content: I've had my timeshare for nearly 20 years, and usually use it 5-6 weeks each year (domestic and international), so I consider myself pretty well-seasoned and experienced in timeshares. This was by far the worst property and the worst staff I've ever run across. The property is an old converted apartment/condo complex. The pool, bathroom, lobby and "grounds" are nothing more than one would expect at a Motel 6 or any other low level hotel chain. The air conditioners are outside each unit, so be aware of the loud motor all day and night long. The staff was rude, rude, rude!! I booked 2 1-bedroom units for a total of 2 adults and 4 kids, and it was terrible--my friend hated it more than I did, and finally even moved to a different resort. I complained to Interval International (my only complaint to them in all these years) and they said they would have moved us, but every timeshare was booked that week (spring break). They gave me free internet instead (which I was told was free anyway, when I originally called). When I called the front desk to get my internet code (after they didn't call me to give it to me), the manager Chris told me that I was calling too much. ?!?!? I had called them twice!! Interval International told them to move me into another unit, but they refused, telling me that they're all the same. The stove-top didn't work. and the toilet in my friend's unit had issues. Our "patio" was very teeny tiny and overlooked the Shell gas station! This was the worst timeshare ever. Only 4 months earlier, I had been in Vegas again, and had stayed at Tahiti Village. That resort was 10,000 times better. Do not stay at Desert Paradise Resort unless you are desperate!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay! Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: gliddle1
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 5 day stay here. Great time of year to go, weather was nice except for one very windy day, but otherwise great. The accommodations were excellent. Very well equipped, clean and comfortable. Close to strip, though renting a car was our best option for getting around. We did some traveling around the area so we would have needed it anyways. Close to the strip, grocery stores, restaurants, etc. We booked our stay through our own timeshare, but being a Diamonds Resort property, they did their best to get us to attend a 90 minute presentation to see what they offered. We declined to do that, but it wasn't required or discussed again after we checked in. We stayed in suite 104, which is close to the main road (Decatur Blvd), so we had quite a bit of traffic noise. I'd recommend staying in one of the suites further back away from the road. Aside from that, ours was very well equipped. 2 BR's with separate baths, free washer/dryer in room, dishwasher, full size appliances, microwave, toaster, blender, etc. We didn't want for anything as far as appliances or utensils/ dishes. Outdoor pools are heated and well kept. In the pool area there are gas grills, which we used, and they were very clean and modern. Overall I very nicely maintained and comfortable stay. Would stay again if returning to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “unbelievable”
Reviews.Author: cumbrian_lasso
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited DPR for our honeymoon, in February 2012. We've never had a better holiday! The apartment was spacious, comfortable, good applicances, more than enough dishes/pots etc for the two of us as well as a nice balcony for sitting at night or sunbathing. The staff were amazing, in particular the concierge, Lisa Cohen, who helped us plan our activities, giving us honest opinions and her personal view in order to get the most out of our holiday. Visit O'Aces down the road for incredible food as well!!

Reviews.Title: “It is good for the family, but a bit old”
Reviews.Author: PTYTraveler
Reviews.Content: If you plan a family vacation to Vegas, it is an OK place to stay in, especially if you have kids. Its clean (no complaints there!), close to the Strip (about 5 mts by car to the major hotels), with TVs in each room, laundry room and a kitchen with all you might need. Bear in mind, though, that everything is dated: the decor, the appliances (they are from the 80s, I think), but they work very well. Takes a while to get the warm water in the shower (like 2 minutes of wasting water), but if you dont mind that, I would recommend it if you go with children, especially. also to note, there is only one bed in each room...

Reviews.Title: “An OK place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Ispeak4u
Reviews.Content: Our unit was renovated and appliances, laundry room, etc. were fine. LOTS of storage space in the kitchen and every room. Sofa was so uncomfortable we got them to bring us one more overstuffed armchair because neither my tall husband nor short me could sit on it without hurting our backs. Needed a little more color decor and had some strange empty spots that looked like something was missing. Bed was quite comfortable, pool and hot tub areas were nice, and open till midnight in the adult area. Good choice of television channels, good variety of cooking implements. We were very glad that we had brought a box full of decorative items, including a string of white Christmas lights to drape indoors, to brighten up the atmosphere. If you're driving here to enjoy the week relaxing at your timeshare, do bring things to spruce it up. Nice having a good foosball table, too.

Reviews.Title: “Best appointed time share I've ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: diaworld
Reviews.Content: After 15 years of timeshare exchanges, I've created a list of pet peeves. They include lousy sheets and towels, cheap coffeemakers, and tiny wineglasses. It was like whoever fitted out these units understood what makes exchangers happy because the sheets were at least 500 TC, the towels were HUGE and comfy, the wineglasses were proper, and the coffeemaker was a top of the line Cuisinart. Well done!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing stay”
Reviews.Author: fdsmfd
Reviews.Content: Desert Paradise is just outside the hubbub of downtown Las Vegas. For me and my family that was nice. The resort was clean and had everything for our needs. The staff was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: dallas52
Reviews.Content: This is second time we have stayed here, very nice. We alway rent a car so it doesnt bother us that it isnt on the strip. Staff is always helpful and they have a computer room for use so you can check email and print return tickets for free. They have a free paper each morning in the lobby. Very nice place.

Reviews.Title: “A pearl in the Nevada desert!”
Reviews.Author: Spicki
Reviews.Content: Desert Paradise is a timeshare property owned and operated by Diamond Resorts International. This means you will be able to choose from Studios, 1-bedroom or 2-bedroom condos, which come fully furnished and with a fully equipped kitchen including stove, fridge, coffee-maker etc. I booked a 2-bedroom condo for me and my friends and we loved it. The rooms were well maintained and spotlessly clean. The unit came with pool towels prepared and had an extra room with a washing machine and a drier - how convenient! Staff was very friendly and helpful. The property is gated and to enter at night you need a pin code which changes regularly which made us feel safe, even though the neighbourhood didn't look too bad anyways. The resort also offers two pool areas. One for kids including a waterfall and one for adults with a bbq-area. The building housing the lobby also offers a concergie service, a gaming room (with a pool table, a DVD collection and a card table) and a courtesy area where you can get snacks from vending machines and free coffee and tea all day. The only downside is the distance from Las Vegas Boulevard, which wasn't a problem for us, since we were focusing more on relaxation than gambling. We will definitely come back!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Debbie J
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Desert Paradise Resort for a week beginning November 25. We had rented a car because we had planned a trip to the Valley of Fire and Hoover Dam. We loved it. The room was very clean and recently redone. The one bedroom worked out to be large enough for four of us. The pools were nice as well as the hot tubs. We thought it would be hard (and expensive) to find parking on the strip but it was so easy and free! We never got caught in traffic and drove to whatever casino we wanted. We only paid for parking on Freemont St. (under $5). The location was really nice, out of all the confusion of strip but close when we wanted to go there. Good location for getting to Valley of Fire and the Dam, downtown and the outlets too.

Reviews.Title: “Desert Paradise Resort”
Reviews.Author: roxy9
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this timeshare resort. We found our 2 bedroom, 2 bath unit very accomodating. There was a washer and dryer which we found helpful. The kitchen was well equipped. We didn't have a car which posed a problem as the resort is quite a distance from the strip. We used the complimentary shuttle (which has limited runs to the strip) and the city bus. We never did find a nearby grocery, Walgreens for the basics. We didn't use the pool but it looked very nice. Overall I would recommend this resort especially if you had a car.

Reviews.Title: “Desert Paradise Resort”
Reviews.Author: Tamela81
Reviews.Content: On our resent trip to Las Vegas we decided to try something different and stay off the strip. We are so glad we made the decision. From the point of check in to departure the staff were fantastic (polite, friendly, professional and very helpful). The amenities were wonderful and the unit was spacious and very well equiped. This property is perfect for a family or group of people. We would definately recommed this property and stay again if we are in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place, Nice People”
Reviews.Author: JimmyDsss
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property for only two nights, but found that the amenities were upgraded and the staff was great. Chris from the front desk was very helpful with all my questions. She helped me plan our trip to the Valley of Fire, and told me about a great sushi place. I work the front desk of a hotel and was impressed with her attentiveness and follow through. The room was nice and clean, comfy bed. My only suggestion is to book a room away from the "family" pool because kids woke us up pretty early. Other than that, I'll be back. Thanks Chris!

Reviews.Title: “OK place to stay in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: TravelPro17
Reviews.Content: Nothing makes this an outstanding place to stay and nothing makes it a place to avoid. Traded a week at ski resort time share for this place. 2BR, 2 bath units are nice. 3 flat screen TV's, washer/dryer and full kitchen. Second floor units have a nice balcony as well. Our unit was close to Decatur Blvd and next to the strip mall, thus lots of road noise, especially sirens! Unlike other time share resorts, the mid-week 'spiff' only consists of fresh towels and a trash dump. Nothing more. No new bed linens, no bathroom cleaning, no vacuum, etc. Good location, especially if you know the back roads around the strip to stay out of traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Third visit - looking forward to going back!”
Reviews.Author: Loll
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay if you want a quiet location away from the casinos. Units are a great size with all the comforts of home. The whole resort is spotlessly clean. The pool areas great for a relax. Shame they don't offer free wireless or internet access......the front desk will do online check in for flights for you though. Will stay here again when we go back to Vegas.......but to get the best from this location make sure you have a car.

Reviews.Title: “super find”
Reviews.Author: jenny o
Reviews.Content: Well this was the last of our hotels on our family holiday and what a super find it was... We read the reviews before going and i tell you it was just as good if not better than we expected.It was huge with a seperate wash room.We all had seperate rooms and the place was imaculate.Staff were friendly and helpful answered all our questions and were not pushy with the time share as stated... It was by far the best place we stayed in with brilliant rooms and everywhere was clean.We never used the kitchen as we ate out the whole time but it was well equiped if required.The pool was fun for the kids and it had a seperate pool for adults which worked well.It would be a great base for a weeks holiday we only stayed a few nights.The computer room was well equiped with a games room. Free tea and coffee available and extra towels for the pool.We did have a hire car so for us it was easy to find with the sat nav and it was secure with locked gates at night.I have to say we could not have asked for more....A true Gem in the hub of it all.

Reviews.Title: “I wasnt expecting much”
Reviews.Author: Melimel1
Reviews.Content: Decided to use my time share and was skeptical of what I was going to get. Turned out to be a nice place. Clean w/ friendly staff. The 2bed/2bath room was roomy and had a patio. Definitely enjoyed having a full kitchen. The location is off the beaten path, but made for a nice 2+ mile jog to Las Vegas Blvd., and finish up in the gym. Would stay again if using timeshare, however prefer hotels w/ casino.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and clean!”
Reviews.Author: Neicy55
Reviews.Content: There are many positives to this property! The rooms were clean and spacious and the kitchen was well stocked. The beds were very comfortable. The rooms were quiet, You could not hear your neighbors. The grounds were very well maintained and the smell of rosemary filled the air. There were 2 pools, one for the adults and one for the children. They were slightly smaller than they appeared in the pictures, but not too crowded. Near the adult pool were several gas grills to barbeque. Utensils were available at the front desk. Fresh coffee was available each morning in the clubhouse. This area also contained a large screen TV and some comfortable couches to relax on. There was a "game room" with a pool table and fooseball table. There was also a nice size fitness center for adults only. This came in very handy since it rained while we were there. Unfortuantely the resort uses an intermediary company to provide wi-fi access and there is a fee for wi-fi. We were able to access the internet the first evening we arrived and were not able to access it again all week. Shuttle service to the strip was lacking. The last shuttle returned at around 11 pm, and the service was not very frequent. The resort was not too far a walk (for some!) from the Orleans where you could catch a shuttle to the strip and the cab fare from the Orleans was about $8. There was a Denny's within a 5-10 minute walk as well as a Starbuck's, a Waldgreens, a yogurt shop etc. Every employee we came in contact with was pleasant and helpful. This resort is equally geared to adults and children. I would highly recommend this resorts particularly if you will have a car,

Reviews.Title: “Great for Kids..or just Couples”
Reviews.Author: The_Idey
Reviews.Content: It's a timeshare, but i got it as a hotel stay. Large apartment sized one bedroom with kitchen, large tub...very nice room, grounds nice too with 2 pools, one for kids, one for adults..also game room and fitness center. Walking to Orleans Hotel. Driving to everything else. Cool if you walk to Orleans, then catch shuttle to strip..Nice place, they will try to sell you their package, the presentation is cool...just couldnt afford it, but very nice about the whole thing. Would stay again..especially for Viva Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: sutrula
Reviews.Content: We stayed in DPR for 4 days. Place is centrally located about 15 minutes walk to the strip and few minutes away from the main highway that connects to the Airport, Outlet Mall, Hoover Dam/Grand Canyon etc. Driving distance to Grocery Store and restaurants. Ours was a 2 bedroom resort with plenty of room and a spacious and fully equipped kitchen and an inhouse washer/dryer. Staff were helpful and courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Great off-strip timeshare hotel”
Reviews.Author: rsxgirltx
Reviews.Content: We have a timeshare and stayed here on an exchange. The hotel is basically a converted apartment complex, but a nice one. The facilities are well-maintained and the staff was helpful and professional. We stayed in a one-bedroom which had a laundry room, living room, kitchen, and dinette area as well as a balcony. There are covered parking spaces. The beds are comfortable and we felt very at-home in our room. My only complaint is about the timeshare sales presentation. After checking in, we were asked to stop by the concierge desk, where we were immediately asked to attend 2 different meet-ups with the concierge and sales staff. We agreed to go to the meeting in order to get some B-rated show and buffet tickets. Then they asked for a $20 deposit for the meeting. We reluctantly agreed. When we went to the sales presentation, we were asked to wait. We were told it would take 2 hours for the sales presentation. That was too long, so we asked for our $20 back and we left. If you do not want to sit through a timeshare presentation, be firm about not attending any meetings that you are invited to by the concierge desk. You are paying for your stay- don't feel obligated. Unless you want the crappy show tickets.

Reviews.Title: “Like an oasis in the desert...”
Reviews.Author: rosieoh
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here mid June, 2011 and were very pleasantly surprised at how wonderful Desert Paradise was. We had read some negative things on this website and were a bit cautious. I can now tell you it was a perfect oasis in the Vegas desert. Temperatures hit 102 to 108 while we were there. Our one bedroom unit was quiet and cool! Very clean, nicely decorated with comfortable beds and pillows and lots of closet space. Full kitchen and a washer/dryer. (Ask for second floor.) The adult pool was never crowded and very pleasant. Front desk staff were friendly and helpful. We were invited to a coffee and donuts meeting to interest us in buying a condo but just didn't go and were never pressured again. Highly reccomend staying here and will definitely stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Super Clean, Friendly, and Relaxing!!”
Reviews.Author: StuckinIllinois4429
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our stay in Vegas and the best part was being able to come "home" to a clean,friendly and relaxing room! We will definitely stay here again! The location is perfect...about 10 min from the strip and away from chaos!! We felt very safe with the gated property and relaxed at the beautiful tropical pool.

Reviews.Title: “All the Basics & Then Some”
Reviews.Author: Renery
Reviews.Content: We used an Interval International certificate for a stay at this hotel. The condo was spacious... 2 bedrooms, both with walk-in closets, full kitchen, dinette area, living room, 2 full baths, laundry room, large covered balcony/patio. This place looks like it was built as a rental condo, rather than as a vacation condo, ie, the walk-in closets, large laundry / storage room, large balcony with closet. The week we were there it was cold when we arrived and the temp went up fast by the end of the week, so we used both heating & air conditioning. Both worked very well. I'm happy we were on the 2nd floor because I think that any little noise can be heard below. We got regular calls from the front desk that the people below complained about noise. They even called once when I was in the room alone, just making lunch (barefoot). So I would advise getting an upper floor if you can. The pools are very small. There's one that is strictly enforced as over 18 only, and a shallow pool (about 4') for under 18. We were there when the weather was rather cool, but I can imagine that when it warms up the pools would get very crowded. The hot tubs are similarly segregated. Our boys enjoyed the game room -- pool table, foosball, chess, etc. The location is convenient IF YOU HAVE A CAR. Very important to have a car here, unless you want to wait for taxis every time you want to go out. There was plenty of parking under covered spaces. There's a Raley's grocery store less than half a mile away which was very convenient. Beds were good, but it would have been nice if there were some down pillows. The lighting in the master bath wasn't good for makeup, so I ended up using the children's bathroom for that because they had better lighting. Negative: I called to ask about check-out time & the desk clerk said 10. It was 9:50 and I said we couldnt possibly be out until 11 a.m. He acted very put out about that. The maids were literally waiting at the door when we took our suitcases to the car. I can't remember the last time I stayed at any hotel with an early check-out like this.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy, hot, troll room”
Reviews.Author: Idamann
Reviews.Content: Desert Paradise in LV was a new experience; let’s start with the positive, great beds, clean but dated rooms, large closets and bathrooms. Nice family space, TV in every room and a full size washer and dryer, fairly new appliances and a large balcony. There are two pools one for over 18 and a family pool same with the hot tubs. The family pool was under construction so the water feature was not working but all in all the water was warm and enough chairs to accommodate families, nice large towels provided in room for pool use. With above all stated, we were in room 204, it was like a troll room, very dark, no natural light even when we opened the blinds, there was a huge pine tree ( I come to Vegas to see palm trees) off the deck so what little early morning light came onto the deck was gone quickly. The lighting in the rooms was minimal. The master bath needs more light and the tub squeaks loudly when you stand in it and it would be very very difficult for and elderly person to get out of the tub, it is deep and the step out is high. In fact I could hear my neighbors tub squeaking when they showered and everything else they said and did. The other issue was the thermostat, we could not get it to change from 82 degrees, I finally called the front desk and they sent over the security guard and he apparently had never worked with the thermostat so all he did was read the directions like I had and nothing changed. Finally, the road noise from Decatur was so loud you could not have any windows or balcony door open to carry on a conversation, night time didn’t change much so sleep was disrupted often.

Reviews.Title: “A Bargain!”
Reviews.Author: Carla222
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travel often to Las Vegas and the surrounding area. We were originally booked on the Strip, but then changed to the Desert Paradise for more roomy accomodations. We had a two-bedroom villa that slept 6. Our master suite had a king bed and large bath, plus walk-in closet. Plenty of room for all our stuff. The second bathroom had a queen bed and another walk-in closet. The second bath was large and roomy, too. The living room had a sofa sleeper, which sleeps another couple if needed. The kitchen was roomy and fully stocked. There was a separate dining area. I was so glad we had this unit for a week's stay in Las Vegas. I never felt crowded. The pool was well-protected, so we could sun and swim on even the cooler days. On Monday they had an info session that WAS NOT a push to sell you anything. It was merely sharing time for the concierge, with tips on places to go, etc. It was so nice not to be talked into anything. They just shared their travel info. And they had great bagels and Carl's donuts, too. We got maps for Red Rock Canyon, Ethel M Chocolate Factory, etc. The only drawback to this place is the lack of luxury surrounding the actual resort. It's just a street with restaurants and businesses, so it's not as exciting as being on the Strip. But it was peaceful! It was about a three mile drive to the Strip, which was easy to do. It's not far from the Orleans. Oh, it had a nice exercise room, too. Overall, a great place!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Spacious and Comfortable Rooms”
Reviews.Author: benjerin
Reviews.Content: I loved the size of the rooms and the amenities. We had everything we needed in the kitchen, happy to have a laundry room, very comfortable and cozy rooms, huge closets and bathtubs. The blinds and curtains do a spectacular job of keeping the sun out when you are trying to sleep in! We enjoyed the heated pools! The staff was great! My only complaints: 1. When we tried to play on the pool table in the game room, we were told that they only had one stick and it needed a new tip. Bummer. 2. This is not on or near the strip, and the shuttle service is a bit limited in terms of times and locations. But the shuttle drivers are wonderful! If you stay here: 1. Eat a O'Aces Bar & Grill, within walking distance. 2. Hang out at the Orleans Casino, also within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful Comfort near the strip”
Reviews.Author: OldDutch57
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 4 days at the Desert Paradise between Christmas and New Years. We are Diamond Resort owners and used points for the booking. I like the fact that this is a renovated apt complex. Lots of unexpected closet space and large kitchen with pantry. While the kitchen counter tops and appliances could use updating, as a Diamond owner, I am glad that my maintenence fees are not being spent on units that are still in good condition and in good repair. The king bed was comfy and had the customary plush bedding that Diamond owners expect. Our one bedroom unit had a separate laundry room with full sized washer/dryer pair which we happily took advantage of. We consented to take a tour at Polo Towers but I actually like the Desert Paradise with its off strip location. We do not go to Vegas to gamble, but instead for dining and entertainment. We live near enough to drive so transportation is never an issue. Concierge info, check in/check out were speedy and courteous. The place is immaculate and they are constantly doing paint touch ups and sweeping the grounds to keep it looking great. I will definitely stay at the DP again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort-Good Stay-Book It”
Reviews.Author: sandyp1017
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Desert Paradise Resort from December 26-31, 2010. This is a timeshare resort and it very nice and quite. The welcome area is very nice and, if you get Shirley, she is very pleasant and nice. Our unit was very nice. If you want the space and amenities (full kitchen, living/dining room, etc.) of an apartment or vacation rental, then this is a good choice. You will need a rental car if staying at this resort as it would be difficult to get around. If you go in the summer time, the facility offers a pool and BBQ area. Also, there are plenty of parking available and each unit is given a code to enter the resort after hours and the gates is closed at a certain time which is great and makes you feel safe. As with everywhere you go in Vegas, they will try and sell you a timeshare if you do not own at Diamond Resort. Grocery stores and supermarket is a 4 block radius, so you can go food shopping and cook in the unit if you like. I would definitely go back and stay at this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place. Terrible Internet service.”
Reviews.Author: nighthawk
Reviews.Content: This resort is not as deluxe as most timeshare resorts, but is a nice place to stay if you have a rental car. Rental cars are about as cheap in Vegas as anywhere, so if you're going to be there for more than a couple days, it is highly recommended. The resort has scheduled shuttle service to several locations on the Strip. It is about 10 minutes from the Strip, in a safe, convenient neighborhood, has a wonderful outdoor recreation area with 2 pools, hot tub, and playground equipment. hot tub. The grounds are nicely landcaped. There is as fully equiped fitness center on site. Parking is at or near you door, much of it covered parking. There are first and second floor units, so if you are seniors, be sure to request a ground floor unit as there are many steps to the 2nd floor units and no elevators. Also ask for a unit away from the main street and you will have a pleasant, quiet stay. The community is gated and is apparently a converted apartment complex, so the accomodations are actually a full apartment and spacious. Furnishings are rather spartan, but adequate. Bath lighting is great, living room lighting is inadequate. There is a patio or deck with sliding glass door from the living room. There is an entertainment center in the living room, but nothng in it except a flat screen TV and DVD player. There is no stereo, CD or music player in the living area, just alarm clock radios in the bedrooms, not very accommodating for music lovers, although one of the clock radios has an iPod port and MP3 player input. There are also flat screen TVs each bedroom. The TVs offer a full complement of cable channels. That's nice. There is a full kitchen with a nice complement of kitchenware and equipment, a separate dining area and a snack counter with stools. There is an abundance of towels, linens and pillows provided in the unit. Housekeeping service is once a week. Towel and trash service is available daily upon request. The beds quite comfortable. The linens are exceptional, and if you like them, you can purchase them for a very reasonable price at the front desk to take home. We certainly did. The bedrooms have large walk-in closets with adequate drawer storage. There is no other furniture in the bedrooms except the beds and nightstands. The living room sofa is a pull-out, so the 2-bedroom unit can sleep six. There is a separate laundry room in each unit with full-size washer and dryer. Room detailing and finishing is below timeshare standards since these units were less than upscale apartments. The toilets, annoyingly, are not elongated as would be expected in any modern hotel or timeshare accomodation. The most frustrating part of our one-week stay was the totally inadequate Internet service, which was so slow that it was almost useless, like 10 minutes to download a Web page or e-mail. Staff could have cared less, admitting it was a problem, but doing nothing about it except providing an 800 number to AT&T for the guest to report the problem. After wasting many cell phone minutes on the phone with AT&T, I was told that the service was really bad and that the resort manager had not contacted them to seek assistance or correct the problem, which they traced to a local router on the Embarq phone system. The AT&T operations technician, who said he usually only takes calls from resort managers, said he would call the manager and have her call me with an update. She never did. The problem was not corrected for our entire one-week stay. Upon checkout, the front desk claimed that the lack of Internet speed was a Diamond Resorts systemwide problem, which was obviously a falsified coverup.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic...could not ask for better!!!”
Reviews.Author: VancouverShelby
Reviews.Content: We just got home from a week and the Desert Paradise in Las Vegas. We arrived early but the staff were more than helpful. Shirley behind the counter was simply wonderful to deal with. The pool and spa are open till midnight so we were able to relax late into the evening. There is also free internet in the reception building along with a games room. The suite was fully furnished with a complete kitchen and washer and dryer. The king bed was very nice and eveything was clean. There is also a safe in the master bedroom. Parking was also free and it is a gated complex. Will never stay on the strip again. One note also you can rent a car for very cheap in Vegas and all the hotels give free parking..(both old and new las vegas)

Reviews.Title: “I would go back again”
Reviews.Author: mgutie
Reviews.Content: This resort is part of our timeshare. The staff was very nice and knowledgeable about the area. When ever we needed any thing we had it brought to us in minutes. We had a two bed room which were very clean. We had friends from Delawear meet us there. It was their first trip to Vegas. The resort made it a good first experiance for them. There was no road noise as in other reviews and we were near the road. We would use this resort again in fact we have stayed on the strip it doesn't compare to Desert Paradise Resort.

Reviews.Title: “brilliant fortnight!”
Reviews.Author: shavings1623
Reviews.Content: Having read some previous reviews I was concerned aboutr road noise, I was amazed at how quiet my surroundings were. The resort is 2 miles away from rhe strip and we did not have to hire a car; the resort runs a shuttle on a regular basis most evenings and the local CAT bus service went by every 20 minutes, The conceirge Lisa was extremely helpful as were the shuttle drivers. Lisa saved us a significant amount of money getting us Tom Jones tickets, she also arranged a trip to the local grocery store for us.The air con was very good as during the time we were there temperatures were 100/110 degrees F. were a couple of minor problems with the room but these were sorted out in minutes of us telling the front desk. the room itself was surprisingly spacious an having a washing machine and drier meant we did not have to lug an excesssive amount of clothes from the uk. We do own A Diamond Resort timeshare, this is definetaly one of Diamond Resorts better options and if I were to stay in Las Vegas again I would not hesitate to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “a very good timeshare resort”
Reviews.Author: Dutch Brother
Reviews.Content: The Desert Paradise Resort is a timeshare that rents suites by the night. It is very similar in quality to other nearby timeshare resorts. If you want the space and amenities (full kitchen, living/dining room, etc.) of a vacation condo, then this is a good choice. It is not luxurious, but is very functional. It is about four miles off the Strip, so having a car is a good idea. It's a quiet relaxing change of pace from the action on the Strip. The beds are very comfortable. The rooms were well furnished. It's very good for families with children as they have space to move around and play. But if you want all the diversions on the Strip, then this is not the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Desert Paradise - excellent place to stay for a little quiet relaxing time”
Reviews.Author: diaty2004
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Desert Paradise to attend a wedding held at another locale. My only complaint if I could give one is that the room numbers were a little difficult to read. The pool is relaxing and never seemed to be overly crowded. The gas grills provided for the guests are a nice touch. The washer and dryer in the room is the best. No need to take home dirty clothes. The rooms are updated, the bed is amazing comfortable. It's spacious enough for two people to use with closet space separate, etc. I rent a car when in Vegas, and since parking is free everywhere, this isn't a problem as far as location is concerned. It's in a decent proximity to the strip. If you are using as a time share, this place even has an oven, a full size fridge. Had a wonderful time, as this resort far outweighs any run of the mill room on the strip. I've previously stayed on an exclusive floor @ the Mirage.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, pool, room...bit too far off the strip”
Reviews.Author: StayFitLiveBetter
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a 2nd floor 1 bedroom with my husband and sister in-law. We're a 25-30 year-old group. We spent a lovely relaxing afternoon by the pool which was very clean, not too busy. We talked with the staff quite a bit, they were very courteous and friendly. We were only asked about attending a timeshare thing once, we said no, thanks and they left it at that. The room was also very clean and comfortable although we didn't spend much of our 4 day stay in our room. That was probably our only complaint. Since it was our first time in Vegas we would have preferred to be closer to the action. We were constantly taking cabs back and forth from the strip (dropping off bags, changing into evening wear, etc...). In hindsight we would have been better off to stay on the strip but the price at the Desert Paradise was great, which is why we chose it in the first place. There were a few vending machines on-site but the nearest grocery store was a bit of a hike down the road. The Desert Paradise Resort would be a wonderful place to stay if you don't plan to spend most of your time on the strip, if you want a quieter Vegas experience, or if you plan on renting a vehicle. I think the Resort is more for the seasoned Vegas visitor.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again will I stay at Dessert Paradise”
Reviews.Author: lomoni
Reviews.Content: My kids and I were given a room that had a loud busing sound coming from electrical box. Turns out, Dessert Paradise was aware of the problem and still gave us that room. Got back to the room at 1 a.m and heard the noise. I brought it to their attention and requested to sleep in another room and move my belonging in the morning. They refused to place me in another room, unless I move all my belongings that night. So I moved that night noise was awful. New room had broken blinds in bedroom, had to place sheet in window and water drops from vent fell on my head. Employees were rude and accused me of lying about my move, that it was not in the computer.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! We loved this place. A great getaway from the Las Vegas Strip”
Reviews.Author: SamuelFamilyof6
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 6 (2 adults, 4 children (11, 10, 6 and 3)) travelling around California. We were unfortunately delayed by the volcano in Europe so decided to go to Vegas for three nights. The biggest compliment I can give is that as soon as we got here, we tried to extend our stay by another night (unfortunately - fully booked!). It was by far the cheapest place we had stayed on our whole 25 day trip and by far the most comfortable. A huge suite which was much more like an apartment. 2 proper bedrooms (with big beds), 2 bathrooms, enormous closets, fully equiped kitchen (including dishwasher), laundry with BIG washing machine and dryer (which we needed!). The apartment was luxuriously fitted with 3 flat screen tvs and good quality decor, linen and towels. As for facilities - it is not a resort like you might get on the strip, but it has a good sized family pool which we used lots. It was a shame that the adult pool and kids play area where being refurbished when we were there as I think we disturbed some of the adults who were looking to relax after a night on the strip! Staff are friendly. It is not far from the strip - but far enough that you can get away from all of the madness. You would need a car or taxi to get there though. Ideal for a family though. Negative - I suppose that 2 of the 3 pools were not available, no restaurant or shop that nearby. Really didn't bother us though. Would definitely recommend and go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Think large apartment”
Reviews.Author: MGD828
Reviews.Content: We had a one bedroom but it was very roomy. The complex reminds me more of an apartment complex than a resort and thats a plus for me. The rooms are mede with more furniture in mind so there was alot of space for the kids to spread out. Ww brought a queen air mattress but the king bed was big and comfortable. The pull out sofa worked great for the kids but if we had wanted to use the mattress there would have been plenty of room for it.. There are 2 pools , one for adults and a very large family pool. As the complex is not hugh it was more than enough and very nicely decorated with a waterfall. There is also a kids area with water buckets and cannons. The room was clean, we had plenty of towels, and when we asked to be away from traffic it was not a problem. Decatur is a busy streeet and tough to make a left turn onto. So if traffic noise bothers you do let the staff know. It is a few miles from the strip but 4 young men told us it was a short Taxi ride and a great place to recover from the night before. We reaaly enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “This place rocks”
Reviews.Author: jenmacattack
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and I wish we would've planned our trip to stay longer. We didn't want to leave this place...it is awesome! Our kids loved the pool...we have a two year old and she loved playing in the super shallow area. The room was fantastic: 2 bedrooms, 2 baths w/one very large garden tub/jacuzzi thing, walk in closets in each bedroom, THREE plasma TVS!, and iPod dock/clock!, nice patio, very comfortable beds and luxiourious linens (right down to the pool towels!). The best surprise was that the room also had a LAUNDRY room. Full sized kitchen had all necessary utensils/plates, etc so we could have most of our meals there. Another great thing about this place is that it is very convenient to the strip. It took us roughly 10 mins to drive to the casino hotels from here. The only complaint\s I had was that wifi wasn't free, but not too pricey...I paid $20 for 3 days access. And, it can be noisy if you are on the 1st floor...you can hear the upper floor folks stomping around, etc. Our unit was on the side street (Reno Blvd), so we didn't hear that much car traffic. (that being said, every hotel we have ever stayed at on Vegas strip is SUPER noisy in the middle of the night, and this one was by far the least of an annoyance) We loved this place and will stay here again on our next trip to Vegas. We've been to Vegas 5 times (only once/w/kids) and this was by far our fave hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Super clean, Super people”
Reviews.Author: ricktheeagle
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week and found that the location is great being off of the strip. The rooms, facilaties, and the grounds were very clean and well kept.The people at the front desk were very helpful. We are already looking forward to our next visit to the Desert Paradise Resort!

Reviews.Title: “Still great second time around.”
Reviews.Author: Qmyster
Reviews.Content: Everything is as great as the first time: reasonable rate, clean & spacious rooms, quiet & relaxing away from the strip but not too far, very friendly staff, the concierge was extremely helpful with find tickets for show and also with dinner recommendation. This is our 2nd time staying here on our annual golf trip to Las Vegas, I've been to Vegas every year for the last 12 years and would prefer DPR over all others that I have stayed at including MGM, NYNY, Venetian. Note that It is great and convenient for my group because we always rent a car in Vegas, however it could be a little inconvenient for those who don't.

Reviews.Title: “nice condo with plasma and great bed”
Reviews.Author: KeithL8
Reviews.Content: stayed five days, wanted to be away from strip and big hotels. it is a short cab ride to strip and even shorter to the orleans where I always find the late night craps tables open and profitable.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, Relaxing, Beautiful!!!”
Reviews.Author: proud1xmomma
Reviews.Content: After staying in this resort on our first trip to Vegas, we decided it would be the perfect place to stay on our SECOND visit. In the 5 months between visits they had upgraded the rooms with BRAND NEW Mattresses!!! I've noticed that at a lot of the timeshare properties I've stayed in, they haven't updated their furniture (let alone mattresses) in probably 15 + years!!! And about the complaints about noise, its really not bad. I've stayed on the strip & I would say its MUCH noisier there!!! Most definitely Desert Paradise is the perfect, relaxing place to go after a long day--or night on the Strip!!! Also, I've never had a problem with any of the main office staff. The consierge always too good care of us & our Van Shuttle driver was wonderful and POLITE!!! DO NOT BELIEVE the bad reviews....EVERYTHING ABOUT DESERT PARADISE IS WONDERFUL!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: pattroni
Reviews.Content: Excellent service, nice location. 10 minutes to the strip, comfortable and big rooms, everything ok.

Reviews.Title: “Should Have Slept In Our Car!!Horrible! Horrible!! Horrible!!!”
Reviews.Author: dawg_launcher
Reviews.Content: This is THE WORST resort/hotel in Las Vegas. We would have been better off sleeping in our car!!! The staff was RUDE and unhelpful. The timeshare salespeople were pushy and obnoxious. The room was noisy, cold, and unenjoyable. There is NO insulation in the rooms and the single pane windows allow intense road noise (on a MAJOR busy street) and FREEZING temperatures (December in Las Vegas is COLD!) We had a ground floor 2 BR unit and the family upstairs tromped around until 3 am EVERY night - we were there a week and got little sleep. The fitness center had ancient equipment. The internet service was COSTLY and SLOW!! This place was so bad we left 2 days early even after paying $330 a night. NEVER AGAIN!! HORRIBLE!!!

Reviews.Title: “beautiful suites”
Reviews.Author: batanggala
Reviews.Content: i stayed here for 3 days with family for my destination wedding. I rented 2 bedroom suites and a 1 bedroom suite. The rooms were very clean, had ample space and had a very homey feeling. My guests were very happy with the rooms. It may be a little far from the strip but for those who will be bringing their own cars it wont be a problem. I highly recommend this place, I would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “You'll regret staying here! Unhelpful staff”
Reviews.Author: traveldealCa
Reviews.Content: My sister and I just got back from staying at the Desert Paradise Resort. I was thinking about a timeshare investment and wanted to check this place out. Upon arrival we were pleased with the looks of the resort, especially the pool area. The concierge offered us a tour of their other facility, The Polo Towers, but we declined. We checked into our room, quickly dropped off our bags and immediately headed out for lunch and sightseeing. However, after arriving back at your room about 4 hours later we noticed how incredibly loud the traffic and airplane noise were. The resort is on S. Decatur, a major street and close to the airport. Our room's windows faced the street and the noise was deafening, like sleeping next to a freeway with airplanes overhead. I called the front desk to request a change of rooms. I was rudely told that there were 3 rooms left but because we were in our room for more than one hour we would be charged a major cleaning fee. I explained that we weren't physically in our room for more than an hour; we had just gotten back from sightseeing. At that point we hadn't even sat on the beds. The front desk person then said he only had 1 room left; he would charge us a cleaning fee and move us closer to the street and asked, "Do you want that?" The next day we noticed that they blast music in the courtyard pool area to try and drown out the traffic & airport noise. There are flyers, letters, customer service cards posted all over the establishment about the staff's efforts to make sure guests are comfortable. And yet when we requested a change of room to ensure our comfort, we were met with sarcasm, threats to charge us more money, and a complete lack of caring. The noise, lack of quality and inattention were such a disappointment it ruined our trip. If you care about quality don't stay here, you'll regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and great rooms”
Reviews.Author: Nishantpansari
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel. We got a 950 sq feet room for less than $50 per night. It had full kitchen. and living room. We even got free tickets to one of the vegas shows through conceierge service.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, comfortable....”
Reviews.Author: junebaby52
Reviews.Content: The staff was GREAT. Connie really took care of us, along with the other front office gals. The resort was very clean and we have absolutely no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Resort, disliked the sales pitch.”
Reviews.Author: Kirby09
Reviews.Content: The resort is very nice. We stayed in a 2 bedroom. Our room was very clean, and spacious, with everything we needed. The beds are very comfy. Room has 3 flat screen TV's, washer and dryer, and a nice kitchen area. The pools and activities are great with a family. The only downside is their never ending sales pitch to join their club. We already belong to a vacation club, which is how we got our rooms for a good rate. The only free drinks in the club house area are coffee and tea, not everyone drinks that. Overall the staff was friendly, and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A Great "Off-the-strip" Option”
Reviews.Author: cdth
Reviews.Content: If you are in Vegas for only a night or two, it probably makes more sense to stay on the strip, especially if you do not have a car. But, if you have kids, or a larger party (there were 4 of us), and do not plan to spend all your time on the strip, this is a really good option. The two bedroom was a good size (including walk-in closets in both rooms), the kitchen is nicely equipped, the patio deck was (relatively speaking) large. Beds are comfortable (King in the Master bedroom, queen in the second); you'll sleep on a Simmons Beautyrest. Yes, they will try to get you to attend a timeshare presentation. Saying "no" or "I'll get back to you" works fine. Finally, if you are in town for any length of time, I strongly recommend the 20 minute trip out to Red Rocks park, just west of town. If you like the out of doors, you'll love it there ($5 per car). There are two pools, one is adult only, and a water play area for kids. Both are nice, and have shady cabanas. Covered parking (almost a necessity in hot weather) is provided, and the front gate locks in the evening for increased security.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised!”
Reviews.Author: purplebuttafly
Reviews.Content: This hotel was quite a surprise. I was not expecting much due to the price, but we were all very happy with the room. We traveled with another couple so we booked a two bedroom, two bathroom suite and it was very roomy. The kitchen had everything you would need to cook, and clean up. It also has a washer and dryer. The beds were comfortable, air conditioning worked very well, and we had a private balcony. Yes it is a couple miles from the strip but we drove so that was not an issue for us. As for the timeshare speech, just say no and they don’t pester you anymore. The only thing I did not like was you had to pay $6.95 per day for internet access other than that I would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Will Absolutely Stay Here Again”
Reviews.Author: Wimskee
Reviews.Content: We booked this through our timeshare and it was hands down our best trip to Vegas. It's located just a couple of miles from the strip, which was nice because we could easily get to the strip without having to listen to noise of the strip. The staff was extremely helpful (but if you aren't a member of there timeshare avoid the "free gift). They were friendly and informative, even upgradin us to a two bedroom. We really liked the excersise room as well as the internet accesability. The gate was awesome..I know some have complained about it, but honestly typing in the number took all of 2 seconds. It was nice having the peace of mind knowing we were gaited in, and others were gaited out :) The swimming pool and hot tub were really nice. I liked the waterfall coming into the pool and hot tub. The rooms were clean and spacious, and the bed was oh so comfy (best sleep I've had in ages). The kitchen had everything you could possibly need, and it was nice having a washer and dryer in the unit. And the three flat screens were nice to come home to after a long day of shopping! All in all I would absolutely recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and the best stay ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: walk_of_fame
Reviews.Content: My wife and I always have booked a room on the strip. We fell into this place on accident and it was the best vacation we ever had! We liked it so much that we are going to purchase a timeshare there and go back every year. Caution! Purchase your time share on the resale market you can save up tp 90% of retail. Again this will be our home for many years. The people were fantastic.You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Not Great, but Not Terrible.”
Reviews.Author: bgrojean
Reviews.Content: We booked through a family member as it was one of their timeshare resorts. Going into this, we knew to expect the cheesy sales approach as well as the limited turn down service - it's just part of going to a timeshare resort. We stayed during one of the few off weeks Vegas has - no major conventions, no major acts, etc. Overall, it was a pleasant visit to Vegas. Pro's of Desert Paradise Resort (-/+) Shuttle Service - check "cons" too. (+) Remote and quiet (+) comfortable in atmosphere - did not get a rushed feeling, everyone was very personal. Con's (-) Shuttle Service - it is extremely limited - even days where there is no service at all. The shuttle staff is great, but they need to hire more drivers to increase the availability of the shuttle / expand the operating hours. (-) Shuttle service does not go to the airport... Taxi is the only way unless you want to rent a car for literally two trips (to and from airport; there's no need for a car at this resort - waste of money... if you're wealthy, go nuts and rent. Common sense would mean not renting one.) (-) Mold - The site is under a renovation. However, we were in a unit that was not renovated. The air conditioner leaked water over the walkway to the bedroom. It seemed to have been doing that for a long time as there was a strong mold smell in the room. Another disadvantage - the thermostats are locked. Either it's 72 degrees air conditioning of turn off the air completely. Way too cold. (-) Mold part two. The unit we stayed in had a dishwasher that did not drain all of the water out after it had completed its cycle. As a result, when I opened the dishwasher for the first time I was greeted with a wonderful mold smell. I had to run the dishwasher a few times to ease my mold paranoia. (-) The site is going through a renovation, which is does need - though I did not notice any construction actually taking place. Future buyers beware, their renovation may be a "work in progress" and may not be completed for a while - just a simple observation over our week long stay. We knew ahead of time that there was at least a 2 mile walk to the strip, but the local transport is easy to use. There is no need to rent a car - just a waste of money and more frustration... Take the 201 bus (1.25 a ride per person). 24/7 operation. Taxi to the strip (Resort to Paris in our example) is 15.00 without tip. To airport (make sure they don't hit the highway or you'll pay an arm and a leg) is 18 without tip. Be wary of the cab drivers though... a lot of them will insist on taking the highway if you catch a cab on the north end of the strip - stratosphere, etc - instruct them to take local only even if the cab driver protests, you'll save a bundle. If you cab driver goes the local route instead of the highway, you know you have a good cabbie - tip him/her well. Reviews of vegas in general... Use the safe!!! don't bring a ton of cash with you. There are a lot of shady people going up and down the strip. Ironically enough the police presence is non existent. The casinos have rent a cops, but they can't do much anyways. Stay in groups, avoid questionable areas - north strip by the stratosphere is a great example. Lastly, if you really want to see all casinos - we did in one week - you will have to then go to Planet Hollywood. I would not recommend making that stop, but it is a requirement if your goal is to hit every casino on your vacation. All casinos have timeshare "lead generators" at the doors... but of them all, Planet Hollywood had at least 3-4 per door and they would not let you pass unless you practically pushed them out of the way. They are extremely aggressive. Beware of their presentation - check ripoffreport.com for more info if you don't believe me. We didn't sit for any presentation, but if we had to choose one to sit through, it would not be Planet Hollywood. Overall 3 of 5 rating on the facilities of the resort 5 of 5 on the staff - they're great. 4 of 5 on Vegas in general - more crime than the south side of Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: catlover01
Reviews.Content: We were there the week of September 14th. We were pleasantly surprised how quiet it was. We had a one bedroom first floor unit. We rented a car from Enterprise, directly across the street & with our GPS had no trouble getting around. Went to see Cher at Caesars, awesome show. Parking is free at all casinos, there is self parking, but we prefered to use valet, only a $2.00-3.00 tip is expected. Also toured Hoover Dam, again awesome & Lake Mead has fantastic scenery. Completely equipped kitchen except for a tiny trash can. The only other trash can is in the bathroom. Didn't hear cars starting in the nearby covered lot. The two pools, one for kids with a water feature & the adult pools were great. Also as mentioned before in another review there are gas grills with tools obtained at the front desk. There is also a game room. The two PC's were very convienent, they have 30 minute timers so there is no problem getting access. We asked for a fan for white noise & one was promptly brought. There are renovating two buildings at a time, there was no noise to disturb us. I suspect after renovation the units will be more upscale. The front desk & concierge were very helpful. We felt very safe as this is a gated complex & after 9PM access is by code if in a car or by your card if you are walking. There is a Walgreens down about four blocks & a pub about two blocks thet we walked to in the evening. We didn't cook, but stores are close by with a car & gas stations. We enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “A Relaxing Family Stay”
Reviews.Author: FranklyTony
Reviews.Content: A good place to stay away from the strip in Las Vegas. No daily maid service, but clean and comfortable. A good time share if you want to just rest.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Loll
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay at the Desert Paradise Resort. Apartments are a good size and well equipped. Be aware that there are no twin bedrooms so if you have kids they will have to double up in the same bed. Some of the furnishings are looking a bit tired and need replacing or deep cleaning...but nothing too major. Facilities generally are well maintained and clean - pool areas are excellent with bbq's available. Make sure your get an apartment away from the front main road (Decatar) as that is busy and you may feel a little insecure that people can see you coming and going easily. This is our second visit to the complex and both times we've had accommodation on the Reno side of the complex and this has been no problem. I would recommend this place if you want to visit Vegas but stay somewhere a little off strip without the bling bling of the casino's.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service for a time share”
Reviews.Author: ZorglubWaterloo
Reviews.Content: We went there with part of our family who owns a time share. It was their first time in Las Vegas. First we were so disappointed by the location, it is easy 3 miles away from the Strip! No way to go there by walk. When you arrive they tell you not to worry because they have shuttle service. But a very poor service, only 2 or 3 shuttles a day, sometimes they drop you off on the Strip but no shuttle to pick you up in the evening. But they will help you for sure to reserve a taxi!!! What a help! We were 6 adults and our little boy. I took care of calling few weeks ahead to reserve a rollaway bed. I was told not to worry, that I could not reserve one ahead, but that there will be no problem to ask for on at check-in. This is what we did at 1.00pm. At 4.00pm, still no bed in the room, I went to double check and was told it was coming right away. Then at 5.00pm, after going back to the front desk, I was told the ones they still had remaining were broken and they did not want to give it to me not to injure my boy. After asking why it took 4 hours to tell this to me, we agreed that they would bring me a mattress only, which was fine for 2 nights only. At 7.00pm, I was pissed off, still nothing, I proposed myself to take the mattress myself if they had nobody. I had to get mad to have somebody bring me a very bad mattress, that I throw out of the bedroom. And know what, after 5 minutes, they brang a rollaway bed magically!!! Which did not look like broken by the way. We have been so disappointed by this porr service, and the fact that they were lying to us during all the afternoon. As I told them, they should have told me right away sorry Sir, we have nothing available. A kind of manager even told me "I should have called before to reserve one". We were completely mad. Otherwise, the furniture is very limited in terms of plates, glasses, etc... appartment is OK otherwise, nice beds, nice bathrooms. My aunt who invited us was very disappointed witht his experience and will complain to her time share company. Better stay at an hotel on the strip if you want to enjoy Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied Stay”
Reviews.Author: wish4vacation
Reviews.Content: I bought a 4 night stay in a one bedroom condo. Other than the maid not speaking/understanding one lick of English, empty the trashcan, I've had an enjoyable stay. I was fortunate that the sun was shinning, mid 50's and I walked to the strip. Took me about half an hour to get to the NYNY. I took one cab ride from the Bellagio back to the Resort and that ran (with tip) $15.00. I was a bit surpised at the Decor. Nice blinds, but wouldn't open. Nice piece of pottery on the coffee table and the lid was glued on tight. Tiny, old fashioned showerhead. Just little things like that. I would recommend this place if you want peace and quiet and are satisfied with Department Store/have seen better days furnishings.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable but better can be had”
Reviews.Author: SD-Witness
Reviews.Content: Sunterra’s Desert Paradise Resort is a property that caters primarily to the time-share crowd. While I didn’t note anything particularly bad about the facility during my five day stay there, neither did I note anything particularly good. In short, I can best sum up the general experience as mediocre, especially when compared to similar types of properties in the area at similar rates. During my five day stay there I occupied a 1 bedroom suite. The suite comes with several amenities including: -A full kitchen with a full size refrigerator, microwave, stove & oven, dishwasher, and a minimum complement of utensils and dinnerware. -A washer and dryer (one of the few amenities not usually offered in this type of property). -Two TV’s (bedroom and living room) -DVD and VCR players (living room only) -Patio with table and chairs While the list of amenities definitely puts the resort ahead of a typical Las Vegas hotel room, closer inspection reveals that this property suffers in comparison to similar types of properties in the Las Vegas area that can be had at similar rates. Points which detract from the amenities and the overall experience include: - A bland, uninspired and incongruous interior décor with mediocre quality furniture in mediocre condition. Specifically, the décor is typical Best Western but with no universal theme, either in a particular room or throughout the suite. The quality of the furniture and furnishings can best be described as WalMart or Target quality and, although not falling apart, the majority has definitely seen better days and looked it. Other properties of this type offer much better furnishings and much nicer decors. - The appliances are all Whirlpool’s economy models. So don’t expect any of the better features such as a timer for the oven. Again, similar types of properties in this area offer better models of appliances with more features. - The same can be said of the TVs and DVD player. The TV does not offer anyway to access the DVD input directly. Instead you have to turn the TV to channel 2 and then change the channel down one on the remote to access the auxiliary input. It appears that the remote was specifically made for hotel rooms and doesn’t anticipate the need for the TV to access an auxiliary input. I never did figure out how to access the VCR from the TV, but since it wasn’t plugged into the TV and I didn’t have any videocassettes I wanted to play I didn’t worry about it. I guess the management expects you to unplug the cables from the back of the DVD player and plug them into the VCR if you want to use it. Also, only an average compliment of TV channels was available (I was really looking forward to watching AMC and there was, of course, no HBO, Cinemax, or other premium channels), and there was no channel listing or guide available. Again, the entertainment compares well to the average Las Vegas hotel room, but other properties of this type in this area offer much better setups with a full compliment of channels, a channel guide, a full featured remote, etc. In other words, much more like home. An even more glaring deficiency, even compared to standard hotel rooms, is the lack of free WiFi access. At Sunterra’s Paradise Resort you have to pay for WiFi: a minimum of $22 for 3 days or $40 per week (although free access is available in the lobby). And sadly, in my suite, I had to be within 4 ft. of a window before I could even connect to it (and that’s with a brand new MacBook Pro). These days even economy hotels offer free WiFi. There are many other examples of a bent towards economy in the furnishings, for example: -The floor creaked loudly when I walked on it (no consequence to me but I can imagine what it was like for the residents below me). -All of the light bulbs used are the lowest wattage possible (there never seemed to be enough light in any room even with all of the fixtures turned on.) -There were only two small waste cans for the entire suite, one next to the toilet and the other hidden in the kitchen pantry. -There was a large walk-in closet for the bedroom but it only came with 12 hangers, and the coat closet in the living room had none. -There were no towel racks in the bathroom. Only a single towel hook next to the shower and a double hook on the door to the toilet. -The bathroom had a standard tub and low-flow showerhead. No water massage. Again, none of the preceding can be considered a significant deficiency (with the possible exception of the WiFi access) when compared to an economy hotel room, but together they present a pervasive air of economy and significantly detract from the overall experience. Especially when compared to similar types of properties in the area at similar prices. Lastly, outside of the suite itself, the bent towards economy and a lack of consideration for the guests continued. One example is that the pool and Jacuzzi were both closed (ostensibly for maintenance) during my stay. A note given to me at registration indicated that they would both be closed from September through November. A friend of mine that lives in the area indicated that this is a frequent tactic used by area hotels so they don’t have to heat their pool facilities in the cold weather. Another example is that the grounds keeping staff decided that they would manicure the rockscape next to the guest’s parking stalls while the guest’s cars were still parked in them, covering them with a thick layer of dust in the process. Normal consideration of the guests would have dictated that the affected stalls be roped off or, at least, the guests warned to move their vehicles. Would I stay there again? Possibly, if no other similar facilities were available (the one I normally stay at was booked). Certainly the price was reasonable (although Expedia indicated that I received a highly discounted rate). And the location is only about 20 minutes from the south end of the strip during rush hour (10 to 15 minutes at less congested times) if that’s your objective. But, given a choice, much better accommodations can be had for the same or even less price.

Reviews.Title: “Great For Old Folk More like a retirement village than a resort”
Reviews.Author: Traveller2120
Reviews.Content: Nice property not far from the strip. We took our 3 kids here for a few nights prior to moving to a 'strip hotel' (not the naked kind!!). We decided to wash some clothes at around 8pm only to get a rude call from the reception desk advising that our kids were making too much noise ('running riot' I recall was the term used) for the downstairs guests. As they had been asleep for around half an hour we could only put it down to the noise from the washer. These are domestic buildings NOT commercial properties, hence there is very little between you and the next guest. I apologised the next morning to the guests under us, and they gave the impression that short term guests like us are an interruption to their lifestyle. We are in our mid 30's, so we are not your loud 20 somethings. The property is nice and pool was good for the kids, but the older people 60 and 70 year olds (may have been time share owners) frowned at our kids splashing in the pool as they lazed in their floating chairs. Upon checkout we were hassled by the time share people, as we were some 15000km from home, it was highly unlikely that we would have invested in their schemes, and they were quite ok with that. We would probraly not stay here again, due to the uneasy feeling that we got from the older residents, but would recommend this place to my nanna and pop.

Reviews.Title: “Shock and Awe”
Reviews.Author: Gill37972
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Desert Paradise Resort when we visited Vegas for my sister-in-laws wedding. We are so pleased that we stayed off strip! The resort was typical timeshare. The apartment was clean, spacious and welcoming. We stayed in a two bedroom apartment. The exterior of resort was being decorated whilst we were there but there was minimal disruption and the buildings looked much better for it. The pool area was also undergoing some renovation and one pool and spa was completely closed - this meant that everyone was crammed around the family pool - it was busy but not too bad. The resort staff were friendly but the concierge were a bit of a nightmare - they were calling us sometimes twice daily to try and get us to see an apartment even though we had told them that we were not interested and that we already had a timeshare. The message finally got through on about day 5 out of 7!! Overall I would recomend this resort but be firm with the staff.

Reviews.Title: “a good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: clemi48
Reviews.Content: The Desert Paradise resort is situated about 2 miles from the strip, running parallel to it. It is in quite a quiet location,but the road can be busy in the morning. The apartments are well appointed with plenty of closet space. There is a good sized room for washing and drying. The car parking is undercover which keeps the cars cool from the sun. The swimming pool area can only be entered by use of the door keys. There is also a good water play area for the children. There is a family pool and hot tub, as well as an adult only pool and hot tub,(closed for the entire week we were there) Unfortunately there is no control over whether children go in the adult only pool. A minibus goes down to the strip, but only at certain times in the early evening. Parking is free at the casinos. There is coffee available in the reception area. A good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing compared to the pictures”
Reviews.Author: travelingmates
Reviews.Content: This timeshare was given to us to use and it was not what the pictures they have looked like. The pool area in the pictures they show are not as crisp and gorgeous when you see this place in person. This property was actually an apartment complex and it's not one of their best which they told us at the timeshare presentation, which is a joke. They are in the process of renovating this property but they told us that it's going to be a while. You can see the crackling in the bathroom toilet seats, tubs, etc. Not all cookware was there that was suppose to be there. Not much room to walk in the main master bedroom, I bumped the tv cabinet twice and hit my toe, it's too close to the bed. Adult pool? sure...kids were using it. Clean? yes, but when you try to walk through the pool area to get to the main lobby, you have to walk through everyone's shoes, slippers, towels, toys etc. which could be hazardous because it's not enough room and you could fall into the pool. The presentation manager for the timeshare is the most rudest man on the face of this earth, he was a jerk. I came very close to signing the dotted line but wanted till the end of the day to decide...he just came back to us and cussed at us and said you guys are just here to get the damn free gifts...what freakin gifts? a show ticket, buffet lunch...I could do away with that. I told them at sunterra that i would never ever buy one of their properties. Once you check in, they make you go to the next counter where they talk you into going to the presentation.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: lalalalal
Reviews.Content: great location however must rent a car if you choose to be around the strips partylife but a great place nice pool, clean room would def. comeback and stay here or other sunterra resorts

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: jodebode
Reviews.Content: We had purchased a Sunterra Escapes package in March of 2006 and stayed at the Desert Paradise Resort in Las Vegas to use our points. It was our first time in Vegas and we thought the resort was great. It was just my husband and I (both 30). When we booked, all that was left were 2 bedroom suites, so that was what we were given. It was may more space than we needed, but we liked having an extra room to put our luggage in so our room seemed very tidy the whole time. It was great having 2 bathrooms also. Overall, the resort was certainly not 5-star, but it was very nice. The beds were so comfortable! The adult pool and hot tub were not working while we were there which was a little disappointing, but the family pool was great. Being off-strip, we did rent a car and we never had a problem driving through town or finding parking spaces at any of the casinos on the strip. There is a shuttle to the strip from the hotel, but it doesn't run very late at night. Overall, I think this was a great place to stay, very relaxing and affordable. It would be terrific for a family.

Reviews.Title: “OK Stay”
Reviews.Author: Sactown5
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a stay at the Desert Paradise Resort. We had a two bedroom unit. Basic unit, but comfortable - including bed. Pool was nice, my children were with us and took advantage of it a few times. They had a big waterfall which was a lot of fun. Had a few relatively minor issues (no batteries in the remote, and garbage disposal that didn't work). However, the property responded quickly when notified of the issues. The property met our needs - nothing more, nothing less. Location was fine. Highly advisable to rent a car however. Had we not had one, would have been a number of fairly costly cab rides.

Reviews.Title: “Great... until I saw the roach”
Reviews.Author: ThatBrownGirl
Reviews.Content: Perfect location away from the jammed Strip! You definately need a car, though there is a shuttle for guests (last run is at 10:00 pm). If you want casino action, the Orleans is very close and easy to get to. Upon first glance, the place is great, especially for families. It is like a condo and the units have their own washers/dryers. My stay was clean and comfy... until I saw the gigantic roach running through the living room on my way out the door to check out (I dropped everything, emptied my bags and shook them out!). If that doesn't bother you, then enjoy. But, if you are squeemish like me, then I recommend that you don't unpack and keep everything zipped and off the floor. Beware the timeshare pitch. If you don't want to go to a "presentation," then refuse all gifts. Nothing comes free.

HotelInfo.Name: Desert Paradise Resort
HotelInfo.Address: 5165 S. Decatur Blvd., Las Vegas, NV 89118
